what_i_went_through: Attempted to access the Bayzat application by navigating to the login page. Multiple attempts were made to automate the login process using various Playwright methods.
what_i_came_across: Standard Bayzat login form with email/password fields, magic link option, Google/Microsoft SSO options, and promotional banner for Smart Invoice Management.

what_i_saw.page_structure: Login page with centered authentication form, left-side promotional content area
visible_elements: Log in without password link (magic link)
what_i_saw.data_displayed: Login form fields and authentication options

actions_i_performed.action: Attempted to fill email field using multiple methods
actions_i_performed.result: Playwright automation encountered persistent timeout errors. The input fields were not accessible via standard selectors (type=email, placeholder matching, etc.)

actions_i_performed.action: Attempted to use JavaScript evaluation to manipulate form fields
actions_i_performed.result: JavaScript evaluate function returned undefined consistently, indicating possible MCP integration issue or browser context problem

actions_i_performed.action: Attempted to use React-specific value setting
actions_i_performed.target: Email and password fields with React state management
actions_i_performed.result: Failed - unable to properly trigger React synthetic events for form validation

success_outcomes: Successfully captured screenshots of login interface
error_outcomes: Unable to locate input fields using standard Playwright selectors
Timeout errors on all fill/click operations (30s timeout exceeded)
unexpected_behaviors: Playwright MCP evaluate function returning undefined for all JavaScript executions
Standard Material-UI input selectors not working despite visible elements in screenshots
Form elements visible in HTML but not accessible via Playwright automation

what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The AI report builder cannot generate complex, multi-field reports that aggregate data across different platform modules such as Payroll and Leave Management.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Users must manually compile reports by extracting data separately from multiple sources.

steps: Access pre-built HR dashboard
Create new dashboards by clicking 'New Dashboard'
Enter natural language query to add insights
Choose visualization format for dashboard tiles
Save dashboard tile
Rename or delete dashboard tiles
Rearrange dashboard layout
Search dashboards
Refresh dashboards manually or wait for weekly refresh
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Users can create, customize, and manage AI dashboards with insights visualized in chosen formats, with tiles auto-arranged for a clean layout.

steps: Access AI Reports via dashboard menu
Use pre-built reports or create custom reports using input bar
Apply filters such as date ranges, employee filters, or departments
Generate report
Review report
Download or save report data or images
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Users can generate AI reports with specific queries and filters, review results, and download or save reports. Feature is currently in beta with ongoing enhancements.

what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The AI report builder cannot generate complex, multi-field reports that aggregate data across different platform modules such as Payroll and Leave Management.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Users must manually compile reports by extracting data separately from multiple sources.
